Housing and property

It is the Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation that is responsible for housing and house-building policy. The Ministry of Agriculture and Food is responsible for agricultural policy. The Ministry of Children, Equality and Social Inclusion works to strengthen consumer rights.
On this page you will find general information and documents relating to housing and property. You can explore this topic in more detail by using the menu on the right.

Research on local governments and regions, dwellings, buildings and the environment

The Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation is responsible for areas of expertise that include local government administration and the implementation of elections, regional and district policy and housing and building policy.
A future-oriented Government Building Complex
[Press release, Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation, 25.05.2014]

“History will unite with the future. We will change, but also preserve. The new Government Building Complex will be modern, stimulate vibrant and safe urban spaces and create good jobs, while also preserving our history,” says Prime Minister Erna Solberg.

The integrated artwork in the damaged government buildings
[Article, Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation, 12.10.2013]

No decision has yet been made concerning re-use or demolition of the H-block and Y-block. Any Government decisions concerning the artwork in the damaged government buildings will be dealt with in accordance with Norwegian law.

Land Registration Act, Cadastre Act and Spatial Data Act
[Article, Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation, 28.01.2013]

Tinglysingsloven (Land Registration Act), matrikkelloven (Cadastre Act) and geodataloven (Spatial Data Act) is translated to english. The translations are not official and for information use only. The original text in Norwegian should be used for legal matters.
World Urban Forum 2012
[Article, Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation, 13.09.2012]
The Ministry of Local Government and Regional Development participated in the first week of September on the Sixth Session of World Urban Forum, on invitation from UN-Habitat.
Art, architecture and buildings in the Government Building Complex
[Article, Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation, 01.03.2012]
Regjeringskvartalet, the government building complex, is located in central Oslo and has been owned by the government for more than 200 years.
Rebuilding the government building complex
[Article, Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation, 01.08.2011]
Work is now under way on the rebuilding of the government building complex after the bombing on 22 July 2011.
Act on an infrastructure for geographical information (Spatial Data Act)
Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation
[Law, Government.no, 03.09.2010]
The Act shall promote good and efficient access to public geographical information (spatial data) for public and private purposes.
